comments:
Build ID: Build id: I20070525-1350

Steps To Reproduce:
1. create simple a.jsp file based on "New JSP file (HTML)" template.
2. rename it to b.jsp

When rename refactoring finishes exception follows:
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource '/a/WebContent/a.jsp' does not exist.

More information:
Reproducable for WTP2.0 RC1
I can't recreate this issue in the RC1 build by follwong the steps lsited . Can you provide additional info?

I didn't pay attention to one circumstance: provided exception stacktrace got output in console of eclipse instance that was debugging another one (in which i was renaming jsp files).

However, described steps do break something, since after completing them content assist popup stops showing up for jsp files ("content assist not available at current location"). After reviewing that stacktrace it seems that this bug and previous (bug 189338) relate to some other mechanisms in WTP (jst.jsp?), not JSF Tools. Sorry.
Moving this to the JSP component

Raghu, you need to also reassign a bug to default assignee for the inbox notifications to be sent.

Forwarding to validation component.  While the file in question is a JSP file, there is no JSP component code in the stack trace.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 184295 ***
